thread.section_title: Foreign and national political news and analysis - San Francisco Chronicle
thread.title: Bush donors embrace new mantra: He's built to last
thread.title_full: Bush donors embrace new mantra: He's built to last - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Julie Bykowicz and Thomas Beaumont, Associated Press
title: Bush donors embrace new mantra: He's built to last
text: Photo: Gene J. Puskar, AP In this Sept. 29, 2015, photo, Republican presidential candidate, former Florida Gov. Jeb Bush outlines his energy policy during a visit to Rice Energy, an oil and gas company based in Canonsburg, Pa. Bush’s challenge in the first half of the year was daunting yet simple. To be considered a fundraising success, the Republican presidential candidate had to hit the magic number of $100 million, an ambitious goal set by some in his campaign. And he did. As another fundraising period ends, what now constitutes success for Bush isn’t as clear cut. In this Sept. 29, 2015, photo, Republican presidential candidate,... WASHINGTON (AP) — Jeb Bush's challenge in the first half of the year was daunting yet simple. To be considered a fundraising success, the Republican presidential candidate had to hit the magic number of $100 million, an ambitious goal set by some in his campaign. And he did. In this Sept. 29, 2015, photo, Republican presidential candidate, former Florida Gov. WASHINGTON (AP) — Jeb Bush's challenge in the first half of the year was daunting yet simple. To be considered a fundraising success, the Republican presidential candidate had to hit the magic number of $100 million, an ambitious goal set by some in his campaign. And he did.
